history.content:
I don't know how we can be any clearer. If 3rd and 4th year LSCS and EECS majors had not yet completed EECS 16B by the end of Spring 2021, and would be enrolled in school at Cal in Fall 2021, the expectation -- much stronger than a recommendation -- is that you would sign up for EECS 16B during phase 1.  We were very clear that students in this situation who did not do so would have zero priority moving forward to be enrolled in the class and would stand a strong chance of not being able to meet that requirement and therefore not be able to graduate with a degree in either of those majors.

The key to being able to answer the question is what is meant by the words "some inevitable problems."  If by this is meant that a student signed up in phase 1 (and stayed on the waitlist) but somehow didn't get in, the department will still feel responsible to make sure they can fulfill the requirement. If by this is meant, there were other things (other classes or research or card games, whatever) that the student would really rather do, then the student is deciding to prioritize those things over graduating in the major -- that's fine as long as one is ok not graduating in the major. If by this is meant, the student took Fall 2021 off or signed up for EECS 16B but was not able to be in California and in conversations with the instructors could not come to an agreement about how to sit for exams, then the department will work with you.

To be clear, if you are taking ANY classes at Cal in Fall 2021, are a junior or senior (by semester) with an LSCS or EECS major declared, and you haven't met the EECS 16B requirement yet, any you want to graduate as an LSCS or EECS major, EECS 16B should already be a class you are enrolled in or waitlisted for.

children.subject: If you substitute the word "California" for "Berkeley" in your question, then I will work to make sure you have access in the first semester you return to being local. Students in that situation should reach out to ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu before their phase 1 appointment for that first semester they are back in town to clarify which semester they will have access. (The substitution is important because I will not be able to guarantee that someone living in San Jose or San Francisco or Oakland, for example, will be granted access in future semesters).

Sorry just double check, if the situation falls into "If by this is meant, the student took Fall 2021 off or signed up for EECS 16B but was not able to be in California and in conversations with the instructors could not come to an agreement about how to sit for exams, then the department will work with you.", which means that if the student doesn't go back to Berkeley (also not taking any in-person class) for whatever issue and has to drop eecs 16b because of not allowing to take remote exams for eecs 16b, the student can still get enrolled in eecs 16b in future semester like spring 2022 or fall 2022?

Almost certainly not. 

A number of students have described what is going on now as a new policy. It is not. Exceptions were made in the past to facilitate graduation in large part because of holes in information flow to students. Policy has been for years and years that students must take EECS 16A and 16B in their first two years at Cal. Given the extensive information flow over the past 6 months, it is unlikely any further exceptions will be made. Students who are new to Cal or who are becoming sophomores this fall will need to fulfill the requirements in their first two years or risk not being able to graduate with an EECS or LSCS degree.
To follow up, I'm an rising sophomore class of 2024. Can I take EECS 16B in my junior year by phase I 16B>
Anything is possible. It just can't be counted on.
Is there a possibility of getting into the course in Phase 2 if enough people drop the course by syllabus week? or is that off the table

history.content: I know that it's recommended to take eecs16b ASAP for juniors and seniors. But if we cannot take it in fall 2021 due to some inevitable problems, just wonder whether in future semester(like spring 2022 and fall 2022), do juniors and seniors still have the chance to get enrolled in eecs 16b?
history.subject: eecs 16b enrollment in future semesters
